cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 230 miles SSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast toward the west-central Florida coast and the Tampa Bay area, then forecast to cross northern Florida and move into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida coast near or just north of Tampa Bay

weather_observation.watch_coast: Anna Maria Island to Yankeetown, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Bonita Beach to Suwannee River, FL (includes Tampa Bay)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: West and North Florida Gulf Coast from Bonita Beach through Tampa Bay to the Big Bend
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm conditions (35–45 kt) expected by Wednesday afternoon with a brief chance of hurricane-force gusts around landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential inundation of 2–4 ft above ground level in Tampa Bay, including Port Manatee, during onshore flow.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–6 inches of rain possible through Friday, producing flash and urban flooding around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, and minor river flooding that could disrupt vessel movements and landside transport links.
